name: places/ChIJSQHANvVZwokRS2JWOlPybhs
formattedAddress: 32 Ericsson Pl, New York, NY 10013, USA
adrFormatAddress: 32 Ericsson Pl, New York, NY 10013-6303, USA

originalText.text: Dr. O’Brien misdiagnosed two skin issues I had. Early in the pandemic I experienced worsening skin bumps that I later learned were lichen planopilaris, an inflammatory condition. O'Brien incorrectly identified them as keratosis even though the bumps appeared in places, such as my torso, where keratosis does not usually occur. More seriously, she later dismissed a strange skin blemish at the base of my neck that had the propensity to flake and bleed. That was subsequently diagnosed by another dermatologist as a skin carcinoma and required mohs surgery. Dr. O'Brien is a nice person and I always enjoyed chatting with her. I am concerned, however, by what I view as professional lapses. I recognize that everyone makes mistakes and perhaps Dr. O'Brien had an off day or understandably misread subtle conditions. I am still disappointed by her lack of curiosity and thoroughness regarding my conditions and her readiness to label them with convenient answers, even if they didn't exactly fit.

originalText.text: I had my first consult with Doctor O’Brien today. I was extremely impressed with the entire staff from the front desk, the nurse and Doctor O’Brien. The office itself is beautiful and Doctor O’Brien was extremely kind, smart, knowledgeable and helpful and got me on a great plan to help with my acne break outs. I left feeling excited about the progress my skin is going to make through Doctor O’Brien’s care. I would recommend this practice to anyone looking for a great dermatologist in the New York City area.

originalText.text: Dr. O'Brien has been fabulous regardless of how serious or trivial my skin problem, advising me respectfully and intelligently. She's prompt, lovely, the kind of doctor who exceeds your expectations. Her recommendations and treatments have been spot on. I've been her patient for years, and what inspired me to write this review was at my recent visit, I pointed to one of many spots on my skin I'd like to get rid of. "I can zap it," she said, first alerting me, "But it will get dark and be that way for a while." That may not seem extraordinary, but I've had doctors do procedures without telling me that sort of thing. Also, she's got a delightful disposition and personality. My enthusiasm is warranted!

originalText.text: Dr Geyer is patient, informative, pleasant in demeanor and gives you options on treatment without pressing your decision.  Probably the best doctor I have ever had.  The office design is very good makes the visit a better experience and the support staff has always been very helpful.

originalText.text:
I just came back from my first appointment there with Doctor Dolder Sarah and this was the worst experience ever visiting a medical facility. I waited for 50 minutes my doctor and than discover that this was a receptionist delay ( at least according to the doctor's words - blaming somebody else is never an elegant way to handle this kind of situation).
After 50 minutes waiting, she arrived, barely apologizing and she didn't take more than 1 minutes to look under my eye (where I have a rash). She didn't ask questions, she kept writing in the computer and she left after 5 minutes telling me she was giving me a receipt for a creme and a sample. I stayed in the room (she left and she closed the door behind her……to me this seemed to be an invitation to stay). After few minutes waiting for anybody…I got out and asked for the doctor again. The receptionist said she was visiting another patient and she was going to be available again in 15 minutes. I did have just a follow up question (since the visit went so fast I realized I didn't ask her how to wash my face during the treatment….probably something she should have remembered to mention also without my question). Anyway, I will try the treatment and probably will be good but….I have to say, would you trust a doctor behaving in this way? and even if she is going to be good, would you like to have more attention and due diligence when you visit a doctor? Last but not least, how would you consider to take our hour off from your job and go back 2 hours later? This seems to be a kind of doctor very much intrigued by the easy botox money and less by serious medical dermatological practice.
